newsitem.title: USA: Natl Health, Rural/Metro in pact.
newsitem.headline: Natl Health, Rural/Metro in pact.

text.p: National Health Enhancement Systems Inc and Rural/Metro Corp Tuesday said they signed a joint business development and distribution agreement.
Rural/Metro will market National Health's Call Center Services and information, technology and software products to its managed care customers.

The companies will also collaborate to combine telephone triage and medical transportation services to improve the responsiveness and cost-effectiveness of healthcare services in a managed care environment.

As part of the pact, National Health's second personal health management call center will be housed adjacent to Rural/Metro's "911" communications center in Rural/Metro's new Regional Operating Center in Scottsdale, Arizona. National Health's new 11,000 square-foot call center will have capacity to handle calls for up to 5 million covered lives. The new center is scheduled to open in the summer of 1997.

In a related transaction, Rural/Metro made an equity investment in National Health of $2.5 million, which represents less than 10 percent of National Health's outstanding stock. The equity investment will fund expansion of National Health's Call Center-based personal health management programs for managed care and assist National Health in meeting requirements for the company's stock to be traded on Nasdaq's National Market System.
